title: How to get the kids involved with family chores from Say Yes
description:
Say Yes blogger Liz shares some great tips to get the kids involved with family chores.
As cold and flu season approaches get proactive about the cleanliness of toys, car seats, door handles, and other common hard surfaces without getting out the paper towels. These common surfaces can hold cold and flu germs for up to 48 hours

asset.author: Lysol
asset.description:
Say Yes blogger Liz shares some great tips to get the kids involved with family chores.
As cold and flu season approaches get proactive about the cleanliness of toys, car seats, door handles, and other common hard surfaces without getting out the paper towels. These common surfaces can hold cold and flu germs for up to 48 hours

transcripts: with fall here and school back in full swing we're getting adjusted to a more structured routine for the whole family. This year though we're trying a few things to make daily chores even more fun first step making a giant chore chart made with a chalkboard and chalk board pen nothing makes them feel prouder than putting a star on a chart so we made those big and shiny the great thing about using chalk board is it can be easily changed when the unexpected happens. With cold and flu season coming upon us I can add an extra disinfecting jobs to be proactive for instance when I notice edie has some sniffles her usual job of put the toys away gets shifted to me so I can quickly disinfect and get those germs away from her and the kids toys these common services can hold cold and flu germs for up to 48 hours and these wipes they kill ninety-nine point nine percent of them often household tasks need supervision so I try to work alongside them to give them a little direction and help avoid frustration. I can get behind any quality family time that's also productive time [Music]
